Reviews.Title: “Family Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Rich N
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Peninsula for 5 nights (My wife and three daughters). The hotel was very responsive in making the reservation, the hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and accomodating. Best of all was the quaint location. Perfect for basing your Istanbul adventures. After a two week tour of Turkey and Greece, which began at the Grand Peninsula, we returned and stayed at another hotel closer to the Grand Bazaar, and it was awful. The family kept longing for the Grand Peninsula. Also, the breakfast was perfect, the views from the roof of the Sea of Marmara were amazing, and the proximity to everything was perfect. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. TV was a little small, and the laptop they had available for use by guests had some issues. Other than that, it was great. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable rooms close to Old City sites”
Reviews.Author: SmooveP_63
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at the Grand Peninsula Hotel in Istanbul. Overall my experience was very good. The 3 star hotel, while nothing spectacular, is centrally situated minutes walk from some of the main sites in the Sultanahmet 'Old Town' area of Istanbul. The hotel, opened 2.5 years and is in good shape and very clean. Ramazan and Sebo at the Front Desk were extremely helpful in providing guidance and information on places to go and eat. They will contact local guide/tour services on your behalf. They are also very eager to hear of any good and bad points about the hotel or their services. My experience illustrated this as when I arrived my single room was not available and I was given a double at the same price for one night. My bags were moved to the new room the next days so when I got back everything was set. I was also supposed to check out for my last night to their sister hotel (The Peninsula) due to room availability but when I returned to checkout Ramazan had worked out a deal with the other hotel so I could remain there for my last night, even putting me up in a double room at same price. Breakfast is OK: bread, juice, fruit, feta, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, hard boiled eggs. If you want a full English or American breakfast this ain't your place. But it was perfect for me. Breakfast is taken on the top floor with views of the Marmara See and Asian-side of Istanbul. The two level terrace is also perfect for sitting at night and just watching the sea traffic and hearing the call to prayers from the nearby Blue Mosque. I always advise bringing earplugs and in this case, although on a side street, you do get traffic noise in the morning and also the obligatory call to prayer at 5:30. :) Thanks Ramazan and Sebo for you hospitality and customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Grande!!!”
Reviews.Author: AintTalkin
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel delivered on all levels for me. Location is perfect in tourist area, and as I found out, also easy access to the invigorating non-tourist areas! Staff was the best I've encountered. Helped me with the most obscure requests like find me a basketball game to go to and who's your favorite Turkish author. Breakfast? Momma mia, who needed lunch! Room was modern, clean with working wi-fi (Many promise quality wi-fi, few deliver). And it's true about the lobby, it's a meeting place all its own. Also, I'd like to say airport p/u went without a hitch. In fact, they paged me. What a welcome to Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “A good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buick54
Reviews.Content: Good communications from Hotel when booking. Used their Airport pick up service, driver was waiting for us. Friendly staff at reception and all through our stay they were very helpful with information , maps etc. The hotel is situated about 50mts from the restaurant / cafe strip so no need to walk far. Some major attractions not far away so that's a bonus, easy walking distance. Breakfast is taken upstairs either in dining room if weather is no good or on the roof top. One warning though, don't leave your food unattended on the roof top or else the birds or cats will get it ! The food is Turkish, tasty and fresh. If you want bacon, eggs, sausages / muesli , cereal you won't get it. Our room was OK, but VERY noisy. It was number 301 on the first floor above the reception and facing the road. We had noise travel up the stairs from reception and the cars / kids playing in the street all made a lot of noise. All in all we had a nice time there but would insist on another room when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: SueG2844
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time in Istanbul mostly because of my luck in choosing this hotel. It is in a charming and quaint neighborhood near all the major tourist sites, hip restaurants, shops and other conveniences. The lobby is a friendly place where I met other guests and chatted with them and the front desk staff. Ramazan was so helpful in telling where to go when and making sure I had the complete Istanbul experience. To me, the price of my stay was very reasonable compared to some other places I've stayed. I loved the homey feel of the place and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean in this quiet hotel for a reasonable rate. We had a beautify view to the Sea of Marmara. The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. Major sights like the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia are within easy walking distance. There was a good variety of restaurants 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: StephenSohn
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel and would consider staying here again next time. I booked this hotel mainly for its value and location. Value: Great value given the location. Couldn't be better. Location: The highlights of Istanbul, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, are within 5 minute walking distance. Having said that, the metro trains are very convenient and come often so any hotel near a train station would provide ease of access to places. This is in a very touristy area so you won't get an authentic experience if that's what you're looking for. Room: Small and clean. Service: Very friendly and helpful. Breakfast: Good Other comments Restaurant: I would stay away from the restaurant recommendations. I went to a nearby place they recommended. I believe it is called Magnolia. In addition to Turkish food, they had pasta and other Western food (typically a bad sign). The food was okay but definitely not worth the money. Turkish Bath (Hammam): Strongly recommended. The hotel recommended a bath place that had pick-up service. I chose another place called Cagaloglu Hammam (I visited this place on my last visit as well) that is pricier but also supposedly the best bath place in town. Regardless of where you go, Turkish bath is an experience not to be missed. If you do go to Cagaloglu, I wouldn't recommend the massage service. The service was good but the person tried my patience when he reminded me for the fifth time to pay him tip on the way out. Bazaars: These are closed on Sundays. Mosques: Know when the prayer time is and plan to visit well ahead of the time since they don't allow tourists in during (and also several minutes before) the prayer. The popular places generally have less tourists during lunch hours. Nargile: Known more commonly as Hookah in the States. Try visiting a Nargile place that the locals go to. It was fun drinking tea, smoking Nargile, and observing people.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: VnKl
Reviews.Content: The good points: Located in the touristy part of Istanbul, walking distance from most major historical sites. Very clean and functional hotel with very friendly staff, quite helpful. The breakfast was functional. The rooms are a bit small. While the location is excellent, I found the area to be a bit boring in the evenings after the second day. Hardly any locals almost every one is a tourist, if you want to experience Istanbul nightlife you would need to go to Taksem.

Reviews.Title: “Decent size family room”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, living overseas and with much travel experience. The family room at the Grand Peninsula, located just behind the front desk was a pleasant surprise for the amount of room that it offered; not huge but sort of separated into two sections- one side for the two kids and one side for the adults, with a nice bathroom. After a long day traveling, it is nice to have a little separation from your teenagers and they from you. The desk personnel were very gracious, especially the night clerk, and they were willing to bargain a little bit on our room, which we appreciated. We liked it so much the first time we passed through Istanbul, we stayed there again, on our way back to Georgia. It is very conveniently located in Sultanameht and on a quiet side street. Breakfast is typical for Turkish hotels, but decent.

Reviews.Title: “More than a bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NZHistorianTraveller
Reviews.Content: While we enjoyed our visit and exploration in Ä°stanbul, the Hotel Grand Peninsula and its staff only enhanced our stay here. We selected the hotel for the reasonable costs and the Sultanahmet location with pedestrian access to many major sites and the tramway system. The room was as warm, clean and spacious as depicted. The breakfasts on the top floor were delicious, healthy and all the more enjoyable wÄ±th the view of the Bosphorus. But it was our hosts, Ramazan and Sabahattin, who went beyond these comforts. Their friendliness and interest in us created a home-like atmosphere at the end of day. Ramazan would not only share philosophy and hÄ±s culture but add a personal aspect to sights and history. Sabahattin was always friendly and knowledgeable about local practicalities, culture and history. TeÅŸekkÃ¼r ederÄ±m to Hotel Grand PenÄ±nsula.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya P
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights while in Istanbul, Turkey on our honeymoon. It was perfect! The room is small (the one we got) but very nice and the location of the hotel is to die for. You can easily walk to all the tourist hot spots, including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. The only spot that we had to walk a bit to get to was the Spice Market, but everything else was right there. Great! The staff was great too, always ready to help, they even told us how much the taxis should cost so we wouldn't get taken for a ride (thanks Sebo, Onder and Ramo, you were all great). I highly recommend staying here. The hotel is well designed/pleasing to the eye and they offer a wonderful breakfast. Lastly, the hotel doesn't have an elevator, which is fine for most people, but if you are not quite as quick as you use to be try and get a room close to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Smileysunshne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and I have to say it really was wonderful stay. Staff was awesome...they picked us up from the airport and dropped us off. Whenever we needed something- whether it was plugs for our computers to directions on where to go, they were there!! Breakfast was great. All in all it was a cozy place in the heart of Sulanahmet.... We were walking distance from everything... the grand bazaar, the blue mosque, and so on... I definitely recommend it if u are looking for a nice cozy traditional Turkish stay!! :) The room We were in was a small but cosy.... thats the only thing..but realistically speaking... we were only tere to sleep in the room ..so it really didnt matter if it was small!!! An awesome rooftop breakfast with a beautiful view of the water... It was fantastic! I would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Kerry L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in November and had a great time. The service was excellent and the staff were great - helpful and very friendly. The location was great and the rooms were very comfortable. Breakfasf is great too. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KootenayFosters
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days At the Grand Peninsula in July, 2011. The hotel is an excellent location... a five minute walk to most of the main attractions in old Istanbul. The staff was friendly, the rooms clean and bright and breakfast was great. We really enjoyed our stay. The roof top view was exquisite. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with superb quality”
Reviews.Author: A_Lana_A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and booked a single room in advance. I arrived at 7 AM in the hotel, and even though my room was not yet ready, one of the staffs was nice enough to offer me breakfast even though I haven't officially booked-in yet. Even though my room is at the basement, it was pretty clean & cozy. It's small but everything was in fine condition. Being at the basement, I can almost hear every conversation at the lobby, but I didn't have any trouble sleeping as the bed was very comfy. Bathroom was also small but clean, and the only minor problem was the shower's sliding door - it was hard to close. The staffs were very nice, informative, and welcoming. Breakfast was great as you also get a good view of the Marmara Sea. The hotel's location & price is the main reason why I booked this hotel in the first place, so I truly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: helene g
Reviews.Content: I said that if I go back to Istanbul, I would returned to the Grand Peninsula. And I did. The hotel is situated in the heart of Sultanahmet. It is full of charm, very quiet, the bedrooms are very clean and prettily decorated. Breakfast is served on the terrace wich gives a amazing view on Marmara Sea. The staff make you immediately feel at home. Ramazan and Sabo are genuinely friendly and very helpful.They advise you on excellent addresses in Istanbul, arrange tickets for entertainments, visits, sightseeing tours, hamam,... and if you want to know more about Istanbul and Turkey, just ask them, they have got a great culture in litterature, music, art,... It is a pleasure to talk with them. I had a great time in Istanbul and I definitely recommend this address.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: anna m
Reviews.Content: Grand Peninsula is a small, cosy place in the heart of Istanbul's Sultanahmet district, where most of the important sights are. The rooms were clean, the staff (ramadzan and Sabahattin) really friendly and cooperative (they pick you up at the airport, arrange sightseeing tours.. above all the hotel has an amazing terrace with a view over the Marmara Sea where you can have breakfast or a drink.. we had vbooked a normal double room but were accomodated in a family room without extra charge! Absolutely recommendable, will go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wes032
Reviews.Content: We spent a Wweek at the Grand Peninsula and had a great time. It's not a fancy hotel, but the location is great. There were a number of good restaurants within easy walking distance. It was also a 15 minute walk or less from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Sultanahmet tram stop, and maybe 20 from the Grand Bazaar. The price was also very reasonable. The rooms are not enormous. We had a large double, which was not expensive and was more than large enough for two people. The included breakfast was fine. There was no hot food, but otherwise it was pretty typical for a European hotel breakfast. They had cheese, olives, cold cuts, yogurt, breads, etc. And the rooftop terrace had some nice views. We also used their airport pickup service, and it was very quick and easy. The hotel does not have a lot of amenities, but if you want an inexpensive, clean, well run hotel in a good location, this is a good choice. They do want you to pay in cash, so be prepared for that when you check out. The closest ATM is about a 15 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good option”
Reviews.Author: BobPraz
Reviews.Content: Genuinely friendly, helpful staff. Great breakfast on a terrace overlooking the sea and Sultanahmet quarter. Reliable help for transportation to and from the airport. The only slightly lower ratings I gave it are because I had a rather small single room in the basement, good but a little too enclosed if you can avoid it (and the housekeeping noise starts here early enough in the morning). However the price seems to have been cheaper than the other rooms, accordingly. I did spend one night in a double room which was very comfortable. All in all, very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great budget choice.”
Reviews.Author: peter-beagle
Reviews.Content: From the very first night, when a smiling driver greeted us at the airport (our plane was an hour late, landing around midnight) to our last morning, everyone and everything at this hotel made our stay in Istanbul just perfect! We booked 2 single rooms, one in the basement (no TV), one on the 4th floor. No views, but who cares â€“ they were clean and comfy. Bathrooms are a tad on the small side, but the showers were excellent: nice hot water and great water pressure. For views, go up to the roof terrace for breakfast â€“ delicious yogurt, fruits & veggies, cheese, bread & cakes, and great coffee, served by lovely ladies. Major sights are within easy walking distance, as are many charming restaurants and shops. If youâ€™re on a tight budget, this place is a good choice. We would definitely stay here again. By the way, we didnâ€™t need our Turkish phrase book, as most people we encountered were eager to use English.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsboll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Peninsula for six nights in September. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great. Very near a number of major sites including the Blue Mosque,Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace. To go beyond the imediate area the tram is very accessable and easy to use. The breakfast was nice with friendly staff. There was a great view of the Bosphorus from the breakfast area. There is another level up that is really great to see the Bosphorus. There are tables up there that you can use any time. All in all a great place to stay while visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: adrien62
Reviews.Content: very comfortable en suite room within walking distance of the blue mosque which you could see from the terrace. very friendly personnel. Would highly recommend the Dubb restaurant just down the road which cooked fusion food. The turkish lamb dish was wonderful. Hotel preferred cash to ensure discount price and you could get euros in the ATM which their prices were in - 70 euros a night to include a reasonable tho' not fantastic breakfast seemed to us a very good price. No lift but they were happy to carry our bags/suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for medium budget”
Reviews.Author: HoutBayDiver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights beginning October 2011 and booked directly through the website. All my enquireis were answered promptly and I booked a large double room with balcony and sea view - only slightly more expensive than a standard room. We enjoyed a lovely stay here with all the hospitality of Ramazan and his team of friendly staff and agree with everything already stated by previous reviewers: location cannot be better than this, everything is close - "restaurant street" vitually back to back with the hotel, close walking distance to everything, tram nearby to go to the further places like ferries and Taksim. But even so, I was still amazed to see how small the area (Sultanahmet) actually is, what looked to me like huge distances on a google map, all was within easy walking distance, even to the ferries was a comfortable 20 minutes walk but easier to take the cheap tram (metro) We did have two dissapointments during our stay. Our taxi arranged by the hotel (30 euros one way Ataturk airport) was not there to meet us on arrival and only arrived after 2 phone calls to the hotel and 40 minutes after we cleared customs. As a side note, we took the Metro back to Ataturk for the return journey, cost us 4 turkish lire - less than 2 euro each - no delays and easy to do with back packs as luggage. Secondly the safe in our room could not be used as the key broke while in use by previous guests. We arrived with loads of cash and a safe in the room was one of my criteria for chosing this hotel however, Ramazan then locked our cash and other valuables in the hotel safe for us. We had a room over looking the street on the 5th floor, (large double) with balcony with chairs and small table from where we had bit of view of the Sea of Marmara to the left, an interesting hotel block in front and a lovely street view to the right. I think it was 501. This room is on the same level as the breakfast terrace and the balcony is adjacent to it, so if you peep over the balcony wall you have a breakfast table right next to it. As we had early breakfast, noise in this regard did not bother us but this also happened to be a favourite "smokers corner" and cigartette smoke could at times be smelt in our room and certainly on our balcony. It also was a bit of a schlepp to climb to the top floor but the advantage was we were in easy reach of the roof level and breakfast areas! Take note that there is a roof terrace one level higher than the breakfast terrace and you can enjoy your breakfast at the tables there! Just climb the circular staircase leading uup to it.We only discovered this on the 3rd day of our visit. The views from there are much better than at breakfast terrace level. There were lots of Canadian visitors in the hotel during our stay, and also women traveling together. Mostly 50+ of age but also some youngsters with back packs. Grand Peninsula is excellent value for money in my opinion and I will receommend it to fellow travellers on a medium budget.

Reviews.Title: “excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: ita g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights..Ramazan and Sabahattin were very welcoming and most helpful ... Room comfortable and en suite had great shower .. Location central to all major sights, and good variety of restaurants nearby... Great view from terrace... Thanks to all the staff for a pleasant stay.....Ita...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly, helpful”
Reviews.Author: Trebbe
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Grand Peninsula after a disappointing night at a noisy and overpriced hotel nearby. The small staff here is helpful and personable. The room was clean and comfortable and airy, and because the hotel is located on a cobbled side street, it's very quiet. You're just a ten-minute walk away from the big sights like Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Good breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Istanbul and the Grand Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: Trinamh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul for 3 nights and loved our experience! The hotel room was clean and quite modern and had a great shower with excellent water pressure! When booking I communicated by email and found my emails to be answered very promptly and the staff very helpful in organizing our airport shuttles. Ramazan and the evening staff (can't remember his name right now) were great at helping us with planning our Istanbul adventures. Our favourite recommendation was the walking tour - Istanbul Highlights I think.... Our guide was passionate and knowledgeable and I learned so much. The hotel was centrally located and within walking distance of the major attractions. Another highlight was our night out in Taksim and going to a meyhane for live turkish music! (even though it was smoky). All and all a wonderful time and an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry98027
Reviews.Content: Close to everything in the old town and easy walk to tram. Staff is super helpful. Clean and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel16
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the grand peninsula hotel. We chose this hotel because of its location. The hotel is central to most of the top istanbul sights: 10 minute walk to blue mosque and hagia sophia. There are plenty of restaurants right down the street. We also found their shuttle service to and from airport very convenient, cost was 20 euros each way to ataturk airport. The hotel serves breakfast on the roof with a nice view. Having breakfast every morning was a great way to start the day before exploring the city. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They also have free wi fi, which was a nice bonus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a clean, centrally located and affordable hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: zekom
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days and nights and I had an amazing time! excellent location, excellent view, I absolutely recommend this place! not cheap, not expensive. nice rooms! GREAT VIEW GREAT BREAKFAST! GO HERE!! WHEN I GO BACK TO ISTANBUL I WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angybotcho
Reviews.Content: Nice view..awesome service...perfectly wonderful...I recommend getting one of those rooms upstairs..the view is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: HilRay
Reviews.Content: Three of us started our Middle East adventure in Istanbul at the Grand Penninsula. The airport pickup was a bit pricey at 20 euro per person, but after 24 hours of travel I really didn't care. The hotel room was clean, the bathroom great, just not a lot of extra space for luggage etc. The breakfast was lovely on the Terrace with the seaview. The location was great, off the main street so quiet, and close enough to the big attractions to walk everywhere. The only complaint I have is that for the price we paid (90 Euro total split by 3 people for 5 nights) we could only pay cash, which ate up at lot of mine. Wish we could have used Visa. Otherwise would totally stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Lycaenidae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand peninsula for just one night because it was full and had no more rooms available. We were three adult people and stayed at a triple room. The room was small but very well distributed, the door of the room open to a corrodor, at the right side a double bed and at the left side two single beds. This made it very comfortable for privacy and easy to move arround the room. The bathroom was just in front of the door, at the midle of the corridor. The bathroom is very small, but for us was ok. maybe not ok for a big guy. It has air con (very important in september). The hotel has a good terrace and breakfast is ok. It is very well located, near the blue mosque and aya sofya and many bar and restaurants. I went to others hotels in Istanbul and I think this has a very good relation price-quality (taking in consideration the range of prices in Istanbul !)

Reviews.Title: “we liked it and we recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe G
Reviews.Content: The services were good and reliable (transfer from/to airport) and the people were always nice and friendly. Rooms were in line with our expectations and requests. They were large,clean and nice. Bathroom were clean and well maintained. The hotel is in a strategic position, you may reach by foot any of the most interesting attractions and the parallel road is plenty di cafÃ© and restaurants. Notwithstanding the above, the road of the hotel is very silent and you may have good sleep and rest. there is a nice terrace with Marmara sea view where you can enjoy breakfast and any relaxing time you want. We really like the atmosphere of the place and the family style management of the hotel. I case you have a room in the upper floor there are steps to reach them, however the hosts helps you to carry the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “charming and cozy”
Reviews.Author: carolhonolulu
Reviews.Content: cozy and clean rooms, helpful staff, excellent breakfast buffet, good location to sites in sultanamet

Reviews.Title: “Great -- Good price, location, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JeffB999
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel. Reasonable rates for the quality of the place and the room. Excellent view from rooftop desk for breakfast. Good, though not great, service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Serena_Rm
Reviews.Content: We spent there 4 nights and we really liked it. The only negative aspect was that we booked the Peninsula Hotel, but then we were moved to the Grand Peninsula. The price was the same, even though the Grand Peninsula is more expensive and more comfortable I think. Of course I do not complain of the upgrade, even though one of the reasons why we chose the Peninsula was the sight from the terrace, looking on the Blue mosque. We paid the same price, but I did not like so much that we have not been informed about the change in advance. Nevertheless, we liked the hotel very much. The rooms are clean, nice, the staff is wonderful and I would suggest it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: EagerDingo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July, and returned for one more night just before leaving Turkey. The rooms are clean and the air conditioning is good. The rooftop breakfast was very good, and the woman serving breakfast was always a friendly face to start the day. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, and offered us a few good suggestions for getting around. We used their airport transfer service and it was always on time. The hotel is located conveniently near the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque and is right next to the main cafe street. If we return to Istanbul, we would stay at the Grand Peninsula again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dyo_O_Mite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room with our two children (aged 10 and 13) for three nights. We were happy with the level of service provided by the staff here, starting with the driver who picked us up at the airport. (I would recommend paying the fee for his services). We were running a behind schedule due to visa line-up: the driver was waiting for us at the exit gate and gave us a quick and dirty overview of Istanbul on the drive in to town. There was adequte space in the room for four of us (for the price and keeping in mind that this is Europe). There was a flat screen tv on the children's side (which entertained with its sport channel). The hotel was in a perfect location--the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace were all easily walkable. Lots of dining in the area and lots of less expensive dining a 15 minute walk. Breakfast featured excellent coffee, fresh bakery items, better-than-North-American feta, olives, jams and "made to order" eggs. The other clinetele tended to be laid-back types: the breakfast area setup encourages a bit of chit-chat with fellow travellers. The desk staff is fluent in English; the breakfast staff had a decent working knowledge. All staff were friendly. We took advantage of the free wi-fi in our room until out computer battery ran out and of the laptop in the lobby afterwards. The lobby laptop tended to be available most of the time. There is a small book collection in the lobby--we consulted the travel guides time to time. We were always pointed in the right direction when getting oriented. In particular, Ramazan at the front desk was awesome at getting set up with taxi drivers, and recommending places to eat. We would have stayed here for a few more nights, had we been able to. This hotel was a great choice for its location and price range!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: kmurman
Reviews.Content: Very fine little hotel: excellent location (everything you want to see in Sultanahet is easily walkable from here), rooms are clean + comfortable, breakfast sumptuous, desk service is cheerful and well - informed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: BSL30
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a fantastic time at the hotel. The duty managers were really helpful with all aspects of our stay. Room was very clean and the hotel is in a quite part of Sultanhamet and close to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: salixman
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful, organised and efficient but relaxed, convenient location on a quiet street, spacious large double room at front, good bathroom, plentiful breakfast on sunny terrace. Book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AWG3
Reviews.Content: Over a period of 3 weeks, we stayed in three hotels in Sultanamet... this was by far the best and surprisingly, the least expensive. The room was smallish, but spotlessly clean, the views from the terrace were magnificent, the included breakfast was delicious. Special kudos go to Ramazan, the desk clerk who gave us invaluable help getting around and answering our endless questions. Thank you Ramazon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in the heart of Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SandJ60
Reviews.Content: The Grand Peninsula Hotel provided the perfect base for our family party of 5 adults to explore the magnificent city of Istanbul. Set in the heart of Sultanahmet, we walked to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Spice Markets. The local streets are filled with great restaurants and street vendors. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the roof terrace was a great setting for breakfast with a spectacular view over the Bosphorus. Our host Ramazan arranged all our airport transfers and was full of advice, he was happy to arrange an early check-in for one of our party. There isn't a lift but hotel staff will carry the bags up to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: elizaval
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this hotel on Trip Advisor we emailed the hotel and were impressed with their prompt and informative email. We booked a triple room (3 friends) and were all very impressed. Ramazon on the front desk was always helpful and booked any tours we asked for and was always willing to help in any way. It's a smaller hotel but has great atmosphere and from the staff who serve breakfast on the rooftop (with a great view) to the cleaning lady everyone went out of their way to help make our five day stay in Istanbul a memorable and really fantastic holiday. The hotel is quiet at night so you can have a good sleep and only ten minutes from the Blue Mosque. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to experience Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Kezza051
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Grand Peninsula in early May 2011 and would certainly recommend this small hotel to any travelers looking for a convenient place to base yourself to explore Istanbul. The location is perfect, walking distance to most sights, close to all the great eateries in the Sultanahmet area and a very clean, welcoming hotel. Ramazan on reception was very helpful with advising places to visit and general information. Our room was very clean, certainly roomy and all the facilities were adequate for our needs. Breakfast in the rooftop room was fantastic and the bread was "to die for". Unfortunately due to rainy weather we only had one morning when we sat on the outside terrace for breakfast and the views across the rooftops to the Sea of Marmara were entrancing. All the staff were friendly, helpful and extremely welcoming. I would most definitely stay here if I ever get back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: cdavisKansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Peninsula for 4 days in May 2011. It was exactly as advertised. The room was clean, breakfast was good, and the staff was always helpful. They spoke excellent English. The free Internet in our room was dependable and we were able to upload pictures with no problem. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and friendly hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: explorer29_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Sultanahmet (this is the part of Istanbul where most sights are located - Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace etc.), it is in a quiet street but close to a lot of other hotels and restaurants. The hotel has a great terrace and view, breakfast is served here (we found the breakfast a bit simple but ok). The rooms are clean and everything seems newly renovated, bathroom very nice with good shower. Only criticism: beds could be softer.. The people at reception were always friendly and helpful. Tip for those who are out to explore Istanbul's nightlife: You will find nice restaurants here and you can walk up a few steps to look at Blue Mosque all lit up at night (beautiful!!do not miss) but there are hardly any bars or nightclubs in Sultanahmet. Night life in Istanbul happens around Taksim square. the young people hang out here - to get there you need to take the Tram T1 to Kabatas then hop on the funicular to Taksim. this can take up to 25 or 30min one way. Public transport is quite inefficient and crowded in Istanbul..and runs only until 12..

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aba62
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and me spent 3 nights at the Grand peninsula and it has been a great deal! The hotel is nice, room clean and breakfast very nice . You get everything you need. Location is fantastic just few meters away from Blue Moschee, Saint Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The staff was really friendly and ready to satify our requests or to advice us where to go.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean, comfortable, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtd2e
Reviews.Content: The Grand Peninsula was a delightful discovery. It's very clean; showers, etc. function well; the staff was very helpful; the roof terrace was a nice to haver breakfast in the morning and before dinner drinks in the afternoon (although the view of the Sea of Marmara is not completely unobstructed). Worthy of special mention are, first, the very nice lady (I think her name is Aihan) who serves breakfast , and the extremely helpful young men, Ramazan and Sabahattin, who manned the reception desk and handled any problems that came up--they made our 8 day stay in Istanbul a relaxing and most enjoyable experience. Finally, there are a number of restaurants close by that serve good meals at reasonable prices

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, comfortable, boutique hotel in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: discosheepy
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome from Ramazan and the Peninsula team straight from the airport and throughout our stay. Their English is good, a great help as my Turkish is limited to " Merhaba". The rooms feel to be recently refurbished in Western style, with nice firm beds and the best power shower I have ever had the pleasure to experience! This is a small hotel with tiled floors. Our room backed onto the stairs which could be noisy at times, silicon earplugs solved this! Breakfast was simple but filling, would benefit from a cereal option but the oranges were lovely and juicy.

Reviews.Title: “Another View to the adverse review of the 14 May”
Reviews.Author: Ida_MarieTadley
Reviews.Content: I do not believe the adverse review of the 14 May fairly reflects what is offered by the Grand Peninsula Hotel. Rooms vary and so does the price. If you want a view particularly in addition to accommodation then obviously those rooms are more expensive. I stay at the hotel about 4 times a year and have done so for the past 3 years. Irrespective of their location the rooms are pleasant and always very clean; and I have always found the staff very agreable and anxious to be as helpful as possible. Breakfast is served on a roof top terrace from which there is a view over the Bosphorus providing thereby a wonderful view at the beginning of the day. The hotel is located within easy reach of all the major tourist attractions. In relation to the particular complaint made on the 14 May, clearly it is necessary for those making a booking to make clear in advance what their requirements are or, alternatively, what they expect. I would highly recommend this hotel for its pacticality and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent confirmation”
Reviews.Author: bonuccif
Reviews.Content: For the third time in Istanbul and always at the Peninsula Grand Hotel and I was not disappointed. I rediscovered the pleasure of breakfast on the pleasant terrace that overlooks the Sea of â€‹â€‹Marmara, a great way to start the day or relax in the afternoon after visiting the city. I rediscovered a friendly and helpful staff that made â€‹â€‹me feel at ease and ready for any need. I relaxed in a comfortable room with internet access and the opportunity to prepare a tea. The hotel is in a very convenient location to start discovering the city, near the most important historical sights of the city and the tram stop which move easily. A good place to continue to love this beautiful city...

Reviews.Title: “good situated and quiet”
Reviews.Author: jeanrie
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, great situation (between Blue mosque ansd Hagia Sophia), near Topkapi palace. Terrace for breakfast. Quiet Hotel. Good address to spend a few days in Sultanhamet !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great views!”
Reviews.Author: redwingsarebad
Reviews.Content: Our lasting memory from the hotel is by far the front desk guy Ramazan. He was incredibly nice, recommended some great places to eat, made sure we saw everything in town, and got us discounts for a boat tour. He was excited to tell us about Istanbul, the history, and even told us about his home town of Mardin, I would stay in this hotel just to hang out with Ramazan. As for the hotel itself, it was quite lovely and a great place to stay. It was only a short walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia, and a very nice bazaar. We walked just about everywhere, including to the Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. I am a runner, so I jogged down to the main road and there is a long sidewalk in between the highway and the Marmara Sea. A windy run, but very beautiful. I always felt safe walking around Istanbul, even by myself. We had the larger of the double rooms and it was spacious. The bathroom was nice and clean and the shower was big enough to move around in. We did lose hot water at one point during the stay, but Ramazan had it fixed very quickly, he even asked why we didn't tell him about it earlier, so he could fix it quicker! The breakfast was quite good, Greek yogurt with fruit toppings, crusty bread, honey, Turkish Nutella and other standard fare. It was served on the terrace which had a great view of the Marmara Sea and the massive boats, and from the top terrace you can see the minarets of the Blue Mosque. Very impressed with the location and the breakfast, the rooms were what we expected (but bigger!), and the folks at the hotel were top notch. Without a doubt the reason to stay here over other places were the people at the hotel, most notably Ramazan, who was great to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great employees”
Reviews.Author: truelovecph
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Grand Peninsula Hotel for two days in late april. It was a lovely experience, as the staff was very friendly, the breakfast was excellent and the rooms were of a very high standard. My only problem with the hotel is the location in the Sultanahmet area, which is not a great area of Istanbul, if you like to go to bars and clubs after midnight. However, if the purpose of your stay is to take in the historical sights, then you should definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Anne154954
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the large double room which had a lovely little balcony overlooking the Sea of Marmara. Exceptionally clean rooms, very modern. Free wi-fi in rooms. The breakfast was also exceptional, included boiled eggs, cheeses, deli meats, yogurt, olives and fresh-baked rolls. Location is perfect in the old city, only a few streets from the Blue Mosque, many restaurants close by. The owners were very helpful with all our questions. Exceptional value for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay stay...”
Reviews.Author: Neshalim
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms during our 7 nites stay at this hotel. My room was okay, nice and comfy, except for the pillows...they were too flat (had to ask for extra pillows ; P). Overall cleanliness is okay except for the pillow cases (got spots here and there). My mom and son were on the other room and she complained about the toilet amenities not being replenished. What I like most about this hotel is the location. It is very short walking distance to Sultanahmet Square and the tram station, around 5-10 mins walk. The restaurants and cafes are just 2 minutes away and we were spoiled with choices. There are few convenient stores around the blocks and a shopping bazaar (Arasta, if not mistaken) nearby where you can shop for souvenirs. I like this small bakery outlet behind the Best Western Hotel (very nearby ) where you can buy cheap loafs and bread for snacks. The hotel surrounding was very quiet at night of which we slept like babies after a long tiring trips ; ) The staff were average, nothing above requirements. I just wished they were more friendly and helpful in suggesting good places to visit/eat since it was out very first time to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good small hotel, but noisy in the ground floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: blurr_nz
Reviews.Content: The Grand Peninsula has an excellent location in Cankurtaran/Sultanahmet - close to all the main sites, and the roof terrace, where breakfast is served, has a nice sea view. Our room was very clean and very well equipped with a modern bathroom - they have free wireless too. The breakfast was good and service helpful. Our only complaint was the noise at night. We had a ground floor room and you can hear any noise from reception.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Grand Peninsula Hotel, chosen after reading many TripAdvisor's reviews about it's cleanlines; we found a clean and quiet hotel and a good service; the elder owner is a kind person (but be aware of the younger one: he didn't help us to bring our luggage at the 3rd floor when we arrived and the last evening he gave us a less change because he had not enough money in his pocket...); we had a high quality sleep, on a wide and pleasantly rigid bed in a comfortable room; we were afraid about muezzin's voice, early in the morning, but we never heard it; when you take a shower, you cannot keep warm water constantly running as in western europe, because it rapidly becomes cold and you need to wait some time to get it warm again (i guess this is a common feature in turkish hotels); breakfast is good and varied and the breakfast lady is kind and helpful; the elder owner managed our shuttle from and to airport, but you must know that you pay 2-3 times the price you can pay if you manage it by yourself (we didn't want to do it ourselves). The location is good, near to Hagia Sophia; all around you can find restaurants for tourists (that we carefully avoided...).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Simplicity
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 3 adults in room 303 (family room). Two twin beds were in one room. In this room there was a refrigerator , a kettle, glasses, cups & TV. The room was quite small & the only light is on a side wall which makes it difficult to read in bed. Down a small hall there was a bathroom which was adequate in size. The only problem is they wanted people to put used toilet paper in a trash bin which we felt was unsanitary & could not abide by due to health concerns. The other room had a double/queen size bed with side tables on each side of the bed. This room had much better lighting. The closet was adequate in size. There was a fan in each room, but we noticed a slight urine smell when turned on. The breakfast was good & served on the top floor with a view of the Sea of Marmara. The man at the desk is Australian so communication was good. The location is excellent and very close to many of the attractions. One-half block away is at least 40 restaurants. They were so kind - we had to leave at 4:00 a.m. to catch a plane. One of the workers was sleeping on the sofa waiting for us and took us to the airport for a very reasonable price. Thanks Ramazon, Daniel & Rohat. I would stay there again. They also arranged an excellent boat trip up the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely My Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Mesclada
Reviews.Content: There are no words for how wonderful my experience in Turkey was because I chose to stay at the Grand Peninsula Hotel. As a single woman in her early 30s, I was more than well taken care of. It began with concise e-mails back and forth where I was kindly assisted by Daniel and Erhan whom not only gave me the going rates for rooms at the sister hotel "Peninsula Hotel", but kindly confirmed me a booking at the Grand Peninsula Hotel when the sister hotel had booked up just before my confirmation. My room was clean and neatly prepared each day. Check in and out was smooth as was transportation to and from the hotel. The morning breakfast was excellent! Friends I made during my stay came by the hotel and noted that it was much nicer than the ones they had chosen in the area. This hotel is located within walking distance of the major sites you want to visit in Istanbul, but is also situated in an area that allows for a low level of street traffic and a pleasant night's sleep. Most importantly, the staff were friendly, knowledgeable about both the local attractions and off the beaten path excursions. They set me up with an excellent travel agent as well, whom I was able to book the rest of my journey through the southern and western coastal parts of Turkey with. I still keep in touch with the staff and intend to return this coming March or June 2011 to both visit the region and stay at the Grand Peninsula Hotel (My New Home Away from Home.)

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a more perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Pattie44Florida
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone, I stayed here for a week in early October. My room was very small and "downstairs" (knew this when I booked), but it was all I needed, and the price was right! The bed was comfortable, the bath all marble and modern, and there was plenty of storage for my luggage, etc. And then there is the roof-top terrace and breakfast room (excellent breakfast!) and ample reception area (including free internet access (and friendly help from the desk when you can't quite sort it out). Daniel, Ramazan and Rohat were helpful, friendly, interesting to talk with. The neighborhood is convenient to most everything, good restaurants, friendly locals, lots of well-fed cats! I loved it! And, as I said, I can't imagine a more perfect place to stay. Just hope I can get back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Still dreaming...”
Reviews.Author: cavilla
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Istanbul last November, and in large part thanks to the nice hotel we stayed in on vacation for 8 days. We were warmly greeted by Daniel and his friendly team of young people. On our request, Daniel gave us the opportunity to choose a pleasant, spacious double room overlooking a quiet street. The place is neat and clean and the service perfect 7/24. Breakfast is served on a terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara and the entrance of the Bosporus. You can eat and drink to your heartâ€™s delight, while watching the scenery with sea gulls flying overhead. Grand Peninsula Hotel cannot be better situated: at a short walking distance from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, 20 min on foot from the Topkapi palace and the Archaeological museum and 30 min from the Galata bridge and the New Mosque. If you prefer not to walk, public transportations are close by. Daniel gave us several valuable advices for our visit of Istanbul: where to shop, the best way to cruise the Bosporus and the Golden Horn, the Dervishesâ€™ ceremony, etc. We are still dreamingâ€¦ Thanks to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and honest!”
Reviews.Author: lizannehudson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents in October on 2 occasions and was extremely impressed with Daniel and Ramazan's hospitality. On the first occasion of our stay, we were offered a 10% discount for paying cash. On settling the bill we did not realise that the discount was offered until we returned to this hotel for our second visit and Ramazan advised us of the oversight and had our refund of the discount ready for us. We were so pleased about the honesty of the staff here. Also the rooms were very comfortable and excellent value. The breakfasts on the terrace were delivered by very attentive and friendly staff. Everyone was helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: TerryOL
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently spent 10 nights at the Grand Peninsula & I couldnâ€™t recommend it more highly! Daniel, Ramazan, and Rohat provided wonderful service and friendship with excellent suggestions for restaurants and the best place for optional tours (Volare). Our room was spotlessly maintained and my bed was very comfortable. The breakfasts were superb - and what a treat to be able to eat outside with a spectacular view! Thanks, guys, for making our stay so incredibly enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly service, great location, good price. Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: JJ_DC_44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large double for two nights in late October. Our room was large and clean with a modern bathroom and plenty of hot water. The pick-up service from the airport was convenient and quick. The location is superb - very close to the main old town sights and the tram. Yes, the beds are hard but we found that was pretty typical throughout Turkey. The service both at breakfast and the front desk was friendly and helpful. They even let us store a bag there while we traveled to other parts of Turkey. Great hotel, great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk agents and service! Beds are hard like sleeping on the floor :(”
Reviews.Author: Tren2414
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. Bottom line - great customer service but horrible beds. It was like sleeping on the floor. I was going to check out the second day and move into another hotel because my sides where hurting from sleeping on the bed. When I went to check out, Daniel said he would have the maid put a blanket underneath the mattress and hopefully that would be the trick. It did help but not quite enough. I ended up staying anyways because the staff was great and the location couldn't be beat! The rooms are clean and everything else was up to par. The hotel was close to all major sites and all in walking distance i.e. Blue Mosque was 3 minutes by foot! The staff made great suggestions for places to eat and turkish baths. All in all, great places besides the HARD beds.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem indeed”
Reviews.Author: elpuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of October 2010 for 1 night, alone (my husband and I had different flights, I arrived 1 day earlier and my husband's hotel arrangement that was taken care of by his office did not cover it, so I had to find another hotel for 1 night and thank God I found this hotel). I booked through their website and I was happy with their prompt replies. The pick up service at the airport was worth it. I only paid EUR15 and the driver was very nice and helpful. The car was ok and it took less time to the hotel than I expected. He also suggested me a money changer with better exchange rate. I got room 502, it was a large double room. The room was spacious with lots of drawers. It's enough to 'hide' my things, including my medium luggage. The drawers were great. The room also had a refrigetor, a flat screen TV, AC with heater etc. The room and the bahroom were spotless and I am not exaggerating :). Warm water ran well. View from my room was the backyard though, but I didn't go to Istanbul to stay inside my room. So it's not a big deal at all. The hotel staffs and manager were very nice, helpful and informative. At night, it was really quiet, so I can sleep well. There are lots of restaurants near by and the neighbourhood is safe for a woman to walk around alone at 9pm. In the morning, the breakfast was great with lots of variety of choices, and the 2 ladies in the kitchen were so sweet. From this hotel I walked to Blue mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hipodrome, Topkapi, Basilica Cistern etc. For me, no taxi nor other transportation required. For more distant tourist spots such as grand bazaar, spice bazaar, Galata, Dolmabahce Palace etc, I suggest you to use tramway. The nearest station is Sultan Ahmed (near by, there was this money changer I talked about earlier). It costs 1.5 Lira for one go, no matter how far. I think my room is amazing for EUR 60 per night (in their website it was listed EUR 80, but actually it's only EUR 60 if we pay cash, awesome!). I definitely will be back and suggest this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good option at a reasonable price with good breakfast, roof terrace and staff”
Reviews.Author: Angleterre60
Reviews.Content: Almost all the hotels on offer in Istanbul appear to be located in Sultanahmet. The area is close to the big three attractions - blue mosque, aya sofia and topkapi palace - however it is limited for eateries and bars and we found ourselves travelling to the labrynth of bars and restaurants around the Gelata Tower each night. This is a short tram and fenicular ride from the main square but it's good to be aware that there is some travel involved if you don't want to be left with the limited selection on offer in Sultanahmet. The hotel Grand Peninsula was reasonable value (not cheap, but average for the city) and we were very pleased with our room which was simple but modern and clean. There is an excellent roof terrace which you are free to take your own drinks up to (there is a fridge in your room) and the morning breakfast, served on the roof terrace, is excellent with wonderful home made yoghurt. Overall I would recommend the hotel. One tip would be to ignore the hotel staff's recommendation for an alternative and authentic hamam as we found it to be something of a health hazard - stick to the recommended hamams in the lonely planet.

Reviews.Title: “a very good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lo_zio_ste
Reviews.Content: Stefano and Laura from Italy. We have been at Peninsula for 3 days ( 2 nights). The hotel is very well positioned, very close to all the major attractions, but in a quite small street not noisy at all. We got a large double room, very nice and clean with all the facilities, bathroom confortable and clean with a big shower box. Breakfast on the roof top is something to try, good food and a beatyfull view. People are very nice and kind, they help you for everything you need,they like to talk to guests expecially the guys at the reception ( Ramazan, Daniel, and Ruath ) that are really friendly. We can say we had a very pleasant stay in this good little boutique hotel; also the price for the room is OK if you consider the quality of service and the position of the house. We can surely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good value-fiendly service!”
Reviews.Author: fishfun10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Grand Penisula for 8 nights. They have very reasonable prices and several rooms with balconies that have good views of the sea. Complimentary breakfast was delicious served on a rooftop terrace with beautiful views. This hotel is close to everything in the historic Sultanamet area. We found the advice and trip planning help invaluable from Daniel the manager. We enjoyed our stay in this lovely city and will return to the Grand Peninsula Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel within walking...”
Reviews.Author: AllSignsPointNorth
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel within walking distance of a number of major attractions and just around the corner from a fun (albeit touristy) street filled with restaurants and shops. My single room was tiny (eg. Two twin beds could not fit side-to-side even if placed against the wall), but sufficient for one person unless you prefer larger quarters. The room and bathroom were bothe new and perfectly clean. The staff at the front desk were also friendly and always helpful if anyone had questions about the city.

Reviews.Title: “My perfect travel hotel”
Reviews.Author: terrishaw1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel from the Rick Steves travel guide to Istanbul and I we couldn't have landed at a place more perfect for our desires. They arranged transport to/from Attaturk Airport on three occasions, all without problems. The hotel location is good for walking to museums and mosques and for local dining, the rooms are attractive and clean, large enough, have good natural light, and no problems with plumbing. With the electric tea kettle we enjoyed apple tea every evening. Breakfast was pleasant with a nice view of the water and we had enjoyable conversations with other guests. The staff is wonderful, like a family away from home. Ramazan and Daniel had good ideas about places to visit in Turkey. Daniel knew exactly the best way to get to the Rami Koc Industrial Museum. We stayed three days before a tour and four days after the tour when transportation to Cyprus fell through. Coming back to Grand Peninsula was like coming back to a temporary home. Both the guidebook and the desk staff recommended paying in cash for the best room price. We did and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: gregbeiter
Reviews.Content: Grand Peninsula is very nice, reasonably priced. But what makes the place are the extremely friendly and helpful staff. Ramazan, Ruhat and Daniel, the receptionists, were all so warm, welcoming and hospitable. I wish I would have talked with them more! The free breakfast was also delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel until check-out”
Reviews.Author: costinescu
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms in this hotel 4 months before the trip. One room was booked for 4 nights, the other for 5 nights. 2 weeks before arrival we changed the reservation to be 4 nights for both rooms and confirmed via email with the hotel reception the ammendment. Hotel was great, clean, helpfull staff, great location. Unfortunately, at the check-out, the reception guy(hotel manager?) was very surprised to see us leaving. Even if the hotel manager says that the reservation system is triple checked, i confirm (and i have 3 other persons to re-confirm) that the reservations are kept on a big sheet of paper at the reception. They forgout about our email (or didn't read it) and therefore we were forced to pay cash even if they had a POS machine and they confirmed via email that card payment is possible. Also, the guy insisted that we received a better room and we were to be charged more, so paying less in cash was actually a discount. The room that we asked for was a standard double, it is not our problem that they messed up the reservations and we got a better one, the price and booking conditions should be as agreed in advance. This really spoiled the beauty of this hotel, hope they will improve in the future. In case hotel management reads this: guys, it is a pitty that you do this kind of tricks as a revenge, but it was your fault, not ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff,and CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: leslie184
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Peninsula Hotel at the beginning of our trip and then at the end of our trip. The hotel was extremely clean and modern. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Even the woman serving the breakfast upstairs was so warm and caring to my 6 year old daughter. She gave her a kiss every morning! Can not say a negative thing about the hotel other than the rooms were small and pricey....BUT comparable in price to everything else in the area..... the location was brilliant and it was great to be able to walk to all the major tourist sites. I would recommend this hotel to a friend ! and to families!

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little expensive for the comfort ...”
Reviews.Author: pban
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel that I found through internet, and was able to accept it beacuse they offered me pick-up from the airport at 12.5 Euros. The single room was quite clean and tidy BUT extremely small. The only way I could open my suitcase was to put it on my SMALL bed and not on the ground. Hence 45 Euros per night is perhaps too high (by 15 Euros) for the room. The hotel staff was good and the hotel is conveniently located (about less than 10 minutes walk) to all attractions. Luckily for me, there was an Indian Restaurant (Dubb) just at the door step, which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but reservation screwups not worthit”
Reviews.Author: networkedrobotics1
Reviews.Content: The view is great. The breakfast was good. But they kept reservations on a piece of paper. They lost our second night multiple times finally sending us to a hotel where we couldn't even walk around the bed it was so small. As I understand from talking to people on the street In the US hotels refer you to other hotels when they are booked, but in Turkey they get money from the referred hotel for doing this. The Sultanahmet district is very touristy but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Clean, Convenient with an excellent and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: WMB_NYC
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights and the Grand Peninsula Hotel and had a wonderful experience. The rooms are clean and comfortable with nice bathrooms and showers and its location is perfect for anyone looking to see Istanbul's main historic attractions. We were able to walk pretty much anywhere we wanted to go which was a huge plus for us. The front desk staff was amazing and gave great advice on what to do and see and also gave great directions. Breakfast was the typical Turkish Breakfast, but they had filtered coffee and fruit which I particularly enjoyed. It was also wonderful to eat breakfast on a roof terrace! All in all we had an excellent experience here and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe feel on budget price”
Reviews.Author: ozi-volleygal
Reviews.Content: Right from the pick up we were treated so well. The recepion area is atmospheric and the rooms more than expected. We stayed in a triple and found we had more than enough room, with a little juliette balcony onto the street. Bathrooms big by european standards with modern amenities. Located only 4 minutes walk from the Basilica cistern, Topkapi Palace, Blue Moswue and Ayay Sophia. It took 12 minutes to walk to the Grand Bazar. Breakfast on the rooftop was lovely with a range of food that was adequate. The fresh baked bread was to die for.The local restaurants are expensive by most standards, so go a bit further afield or chose a nice one and at least get what you pay for. Daniel at the front desk was xtremely helpful, and arranged a few activities for us with accurate reccommendations and reviews. The only problem was our mistake. We paid our airport transfer to the driver who thought it was a tip, when in fact we should have paid the hotel at check out. This was written on our booking, but we failed to read it and had previously paid our driver in other countries. Our mistake. This hotel was delightful and a bargain. I would happily reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: kefriebel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in early June, and then again at the end of our trip in July. The hotel provided reasonably transport from the airport (15 Euros for 4 of us). The rooms were new, and clean and the beds were comfortable. The view from the terrace is fantastic and the staff are great. One thing that sets it apart from many other hotels in Turkey that have free wireless is that the wireless signal actually reaches your room at the Grand Peninsula

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellebe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so great. We arrived about 1am and were quickly checked in and shown to our room to get some sleep. Breakfast is simple but good and served in the terrace with a view of the Bosphorus and the view at night is spectacular. The location is close to all the major sites, good food and a great atmosphere. The rooms are basic but clean, good size and quiet (even with the window open). The rooftop terrace is a wonderful place at night. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, especially Daniel and the gentleman who worked the night shift (possibly the owner or manager?). They booked tours for us, recommended resteraunts and gave good directions. We decided to return to the hotel for a few more days at the end of our trip but they only had a room for 2 nights so they booked us into another hotel across the street for our last night. When our flight home was cancelled and we were unable to phone from the new hotel. the Grand Peninsula let us use their phone, internet and invited us to come back and use their terrace any time. I cannot recommend this hotel more highly. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiorellino68
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Peninsula is a very clean and nice hotel situated close to the most important sights as Hagia Sophia Mosc and the Blue Mosc in Sultanahmet. Daniel is very kind and gives many advices for what to see or where to eat. Especially the terass where you have your breakfast is cool. You can see the Golden Horn and the Blue Mosc from there. The prices are ok.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ZenaLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few days in May 2010 in a single room that was pretty small but adequate...the breakfast is a good spread. I found the staff [Daniel and Ramazan] to be particularly helpful when i had a few problems with a bad back and having been pickpocketed....its that kind of thing that makes all the difference and makes you happy to return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BacchusandTheia
Reviews.Content: Very well located near the main sights. The staff are really friendly and speak good English. Clean rooms and great breakfast on the terrace. A real find - we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cdafloathouse
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, great location. Great rates. Daniel, at the front desk, is an Australian married to a Turk. He can facilitate anything. An amenable staff and satisfying breakfast on the roof top added to our stay. Newly remodled, we loved the small, but well designed bathrooms. Walk no more than four short blocks to Topkapi Museum, Haghia Sofia and the Blue Mosque/Arrasto Bazare. And a short walk to the Sultanahmet tram. We had a fine walk to the Grand Bazaar. The Sulemonye Mosque is closed for repairs. Check out the Rustan Pasha Mosque near the Spice Bazaar. This hotel is on a dead end side street. We enjoyed the quiet and the calls of the Mezzuzin.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: catalina66
Reviews.Content: We had intended staying just 4 nights in Istanbul, but we were enjoying Istanbul so much we decided to stay on. Our first hotel (also highly recommended and reviewed here) was booked up for the remainder of our stay, but the very helpful staff found us accomodation in the Grand Peninsula, which is their other hotel and we were delighted to find ourselves in yet another friendly, comfortable place. The Grand Peninsula is very comfortable, very clean and quiet and couldn't be in a better location, close to all the historic areas and close to restaurants and cafes too. Breakfast is served in a bright, cheery breakfast room and if the weather is good there's a terrace to sit out on. The staff are very, very helpful, courteous and friendly and helped us find other accomodation on a night on which Grand Peninsula was full (thanks Daniel). I travel a lot, and it is very, very rare indeed to find the level of courtesy and helpfulness we found here and in Hotel Peninsula. Many thanks indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: NitDelhi
Reviews.Content: New, hence clean, small rooms but tidy and comfortable. Breakfast is good. Location is excellent. Very affordable

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with friendly staff and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: SurfCityCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3 weeks and loved each and every day. The hotel is small with fewer rooms than most which gives off that small, charming and personal feeling, serviced by friendly staff and a very attentive hostess who makes breakfast each day a pleasure. She even provides her own home made cookies (called "Gurabiye") to accompany the breakfast served on the terrace with sea views. Very worthy hotel of an incredible city ! H & P

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Bug-369
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Peninsula a total of 7 nights (3 in the beginning of our travels, one night in the middle and 3 more at the end). We choose a large double which has enough extra space for your suitcases and roomy enough to enjoy. Has a small frig and a hot pot. The day manager (Daniel) was an amazing resource for everything...umbrella for when it rained, where to wash laundry and how much (just a block away), where to buy wine, arrangements for the shuttle to the airport (which is 5 euros each and was always on schedule the 3 times we used it) plus we also used the hotel airport pickup for 15 euros. The driver was always there each time. Equally wonderful was Ramazan, the night manager. In fact, our last evening there we enjoyed seeing google photos of his hometown (Mardin) - hope I'm spelling that correctly Ramazan. Great breakfast in the morning and we concur about the bread - we loved it! Wonderful inside and outside terraces on the rooftop for eating breakfast. Very convenient location to walk to all major sites and close to the tram as well. Tram always seemed full of people so we opted to walk everywhere. Just 5-10 minutes walk to the waterfront too. We were very pleased with our choice of this hotel and highly recommend to all. Thanks Daniel and Ramazan and the breakfast staff for wonderful memories of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Queenslandblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this 6 months old hotel (had been an old apartment block and was completely renovated to Australian standards, I think). The room was spotless, cleaned really well each day,with lots of clean towels, had the most functional bathroom of any that we used in 7 weeks in the Middle East (modern shower alcove, with sliding door), and the service was first class. Our friends stayed in another room and they had the same experience. Daniel, an Australian, at Reception was always every helpful. The breakfasts on the roof, or one floor below, were extensive, and had great coffee to go with the yoghurt and fresh bread, whilst over looking the ships in the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Best bread in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: keito80
Reviews.Content: We were offered a room at the Grand Peninsula because their sister hotel, the Hotel Peninsula was full. We were surprised to meet someone from surburban Melbourne behind the reception desk, but Daniel was really helpful with all kinds of advice about Istanbul and Turkey. The room was really comfortable and the breakfast on the terrace was the perfect way to start a busy day of sightseeing. And did I say that bread was good??

Reviews.Title: “Position Position”
Reviews.Author: StormAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Peninsula Hotel in Sultanahmet for 3 nights on our arrival in Istanbul. The best thing about this hotel is its position because it was only a few minutes walk to everything there is to see in Sultanahmet and beyond. There is a tram within a few blocks of the hotel, which will take you to the Galata Bridge, but we were able to comfortably walk to the port. The room had a good sized balcony with views of the Bosphorous and the room was a good size, although they had put an extra bed in our room at our request, which did make it a bit short on space. It had a fridge, and a jug which we didnâ€™t find in most of the hotels we stayed in . The breakfast was fabulous and although it was a Turkish breakfast, there was plenty of choice. We paid 90 euros per night for three people which included our breakfast, and there was a discount of 5% for payment in cash. The staff will also pick you up from the airport for 15 euros, which, after a 25 hour flight, was most welcome. You can book a bus to the airport for 4 euros from any number of travel agents in the area. This hotel is really value for money. Its comfortable and clean, and for the price and position, you canâ€™t go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably priced and superbly located”
Reviews.Author: algpan
Reviews.Content: We took a room in this hotel because all the rooms in the sister hotel, the Peninsula, were booked up. We were not disappointed. The Grand Peninsula is superbly located in the centre of Sultanahmet and within easy walking distance of many of Istanbul's major historical and cultural attractions. The hotel appears to have been tastefully renovated recently and is very clean and comfortable. The staff are courteous, efficient, friendly and helpful. All in all it contributed to an extremely enjoyable stay in a fascinating city to which I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem minutes from Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: luckywomanSomerset
Reviews.Content: Istanbul accommodation obviously varies from opulent to downright down-at-heel, so we were absolutely delighted to have Tripadvisor feedback steer us to this one. In a little side street only minutes down hill from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace, this gem of a hotel is all you could wish for as a base for this extraordinary city. Small but perfectly formed, it has rooms over three floors. We had a middle sized room for 70 Euros a night, with en suite. The place feels very new so everything is spotless, the bed is comfy and the shower particularly good. (My hubby says we also have to mention the wifi which seemed to be available all over the building.) The best bit is the terraced roof, split over two levels (the upper one with a couple of hammocks for when your feet have been walked off!) and beautiful views over the Bosphorus. You take breakfast out here - a simple affair of bread, yoghurt, cheeses, fruit, pastries, olives, jam. Breakfast is the only service on offer, however, and there is no bar, but if you like it seemed no problem to buy a beer or two from one of the local shops and sample it on the roof while watching the sun set.
