No restaurant either, but there are several right on the doorstep - which in the end turned out to be as good as those frequented by Turks on the more commercial/residential side of the Straits, and certainly much much better than those found in the very touristy streets up around the Blue Mosque. We particularly recommend Ocean's 7. The hotel arranged a pick up from the airport (15 Euros) which is probably worth it because even if you took the very easy metro, then tram to Sultanhamet, the nearest stop, it would still be tricky to find. Once you know your way, however, the public transport back to the airport is a breeze, and very very cheap indeed. Istanbul isn't a quiet city, but in this little area we weren't troubled by any night time noise at all. Staff are charming, and most we met spoke English (useful since our Turkish is limited to please, thank you and two beers please). If you are unfamiliar with Turkish bedding, however, you might like to take a top sheet with you. Traditional bedding seems to feature a single, rather rough feeling white teatowel sort of sheet-come-blanket that you sleep under - and it can take a bit of getting used to!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: bethsheba02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning and end of our stay in Turkey. It should have been 5 nights, but there was a mix-up with our reservation. They booked us into a guest house down the street for that one night. Staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice, new and clean. They also had a kettle and a fridge. Oddly, the beds did not have top sheets on them, only a cotton blanket. Our first room was on the second floor overlooking the street and could be loud at night. Our second room was in the basement and was much quieter. We couldn't even hear the call to prayer in the morning. Wifi signal was good everywhere, but there was no cell phone signal in the basement if you need that. Breakfast was Turkish and consisted of bread, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, tomatoes, cucumbers & olives, along with fruit toppings for the yogurt and spreads for the bread. The terrace was very nice for breakfast, and in the evening on the upper terrace, we were able to buy some beers from the hostel bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “great location good value”
Reviews.Author: david.russell
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights at Â£60 euros a night including breakfast booked direct with hotel. basement room clean and tidy good bathroom (we did get extra pillows, onl;y needed to ask). was a bit noisy as just below recption could here phone etc and the mosque wakes you at 5.30 am. up a quiet side street but less than 10 mins walk to blue mosque palace etc in quaint old area of the city (seemed best area to stay). breakfast typical turkish but plentiful bread eggs cheese melon yogurt olives tomatoes etc coffee or tea all served on the roof top terrace which does over look the bosphorus and the blue mosque. bars and restaraunts just round corner. Kathisma restaraunt was superb a touch more expensive than some but very good food and service excellent ask to see the palace! teste kebab was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with a view”
Reviews.Author: mandarinuk
Reviews.Content: Simple and clean hotel. It is perfectly located in Sultanahmet, a nice walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, local bazaar and tram station. The staff were accommodating and happy to give us an extra pillow and extra sheet when requested. The only disappointment was I initally tried to book a room at the sister hotel the Penisula hotel, but there was only a basement room available there, which I told them I didn't want as I prefer not to be in the basement, so instead I was offered a room at the Grand Penisula. So then I was a little surprised on the day we arrived to be shown to a room in the basement! When I enquired as to why this was the case since I had turned down another room because it was in the basement I was told it was the only one left now. (I booked 3mths in advance). In any case it was spacious and clean. The bathroom has a proper shower cubicle with a strong hot water. Breakfast is served on the terrace which looks over the Bosphorus. For breakfast we had bread, eggs, cheese, yellow cheese, olives, yoghurt and marmalades, tea and coffee. The juice is not fresh (tastes like cordial) but overall it is good value. We paid 55 euros/night. They also offer a private transfer to or from the international airport for 15 euro, or can organise a pickup with the shuttle van on the way back for 4 euro per person. There are many good restaurants in the area and lots of friendly cats about the streets. I liked the Masala restaurant near the Bazaar only a 3-5 min walk away. They are open 24hrs, and have live Turkish music till midnight. It's very relaxed for dinner and apple tea (but no alcohol is sold there).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotlessly clean, but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: sandra_flitwick
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a good quiet location (although the minarets will probably wake you in the morning!). We booked a large room, but the bathroom was very small. There was building work going on directly opposite the large rooms, so that may be why we got the rooms that we did. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have wooden floors. Bring your own clothes hangers, as there were only 3 in our wardrobe. The rooftop terrace was very nice indeed, we had breakfast there every morning; mainly bread, cheese, tomatoes, watermelons and olives. There are hammocks to chill out in and they do not mind if you bring alcohol from one of the supermarkets to drink on the terrace. All in all a lovely stay, but a small room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean no frills rooms and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Haf83
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean, a good size, well decorated but kitted out fairly basically (eg no extra pillows). The location was fanastic . As well as being very close to all the major attractions, the immediate area had a great buzz. The downside of this was that it was quite noisy (even at night).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBella32
Reviews.Content: GrandPeninsula is a clean, new hotel and close to all the sights in sultanhemat. The staff is very welocming. It is over-priced, as you can get a better deal at other really nice small hotels in the area. Check around---there is much competition, as we did not realize. No problems at this hotel, just priced as a higher end hotel and it really isn't high-end.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Peninsula Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feem78
Reviews.Content: Quite and celan hotel in Istanbul, very close to the center. Just a bit expensive.
